title: Daanish Schools Authority Act, 2026
description: Official consolidated text of Daanish Schools Authority Act, 2026 (VI of 2026) published by The Pakistan Code (General Laws).

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title, extent and commencement.
provisions.content:
_ (1) This Act shall be called the Daanish Schools
Authority Act, 2026.
(2) It shall extend to the Islamabad Capital Territory and to Daanish Schools wherever they may
be.
(3) It shall come in to force at once.

provisions.title: Section 2. Definitions.
Section 3. Authority.
provisions.content:
_ (1) On commencement of this Act there stands established an Authority to be
called the Daanish Schools Authority.
(2) The Authority shall be body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with
power to enter into contract and shall, by its name, sue and be sued.
(3) The Authority shall consist of the following, namely:

provisions.title: Section 8. Managing Director Member
provisions.content:
(4) The Managing Director shall act as secretary of the Authority.
(5) The Chairperson may co-opt any government servant or private individual having expertise
in the field of education, literature, fine arts, social work or development sector, as member of the
Authority for a meeting only or for a specified period.
(6) The members mentioned at S.No. 6 and 7 in sub-section (3) shall be nominated by the
Chairperson for a renewable term of three years and shall serve on pro bono basis.
(7) In absence of Chairperson, the Vice-Chairperson shall act as the Chairperson.
(8) The Authority may determine its procedure for meetings and related affairs.
(9) The Authority shall adhere to the applicable Provincial laws of the concerned Province.

provisions.title: Section 6. Managing Director.
provisions.content:
_ (1) The Federal Government shall appoint a Managing Director of the
Authority having such experience and qualification and on such terms and conditions as may be
prescribed by rules. The Managing Director shall be the Chief Executive Officer of the Authority.
(2) The Managing Director shall hold office for three years, however, the Government may
remove him at any time for reasons to be recorded and after providing him an opportunity of hearing.
(3) The Managing Director shall perform such functions and exercise such powers as prescribed
by regulations.
(4) The Managing Director may delegate any of his powers or functions to any member of the
Executive Committee.

provisions.title: Section 9. Governing bodies of schools
provisions.content:
_(1) The Authority shall establish such number of Danish
Schools under the provisions of this Act as it may deem appropriate and it may, by notification in the
official Gazette, declare any school as Daanish School in the manner prescribed by rules.
(2) The Authority shall constitute and appoint a governing body for every Danish School to serve
for a term of two years in the manner prescribed by regulation. All members of the governing body shall
be from the concerned Province, preferably from the local area and shall serve on a pro bono basis.
(3) The governing body shall consist of five or more members who, in the opinion of the
Authority, possess sound moral and financial integrity, enjoy an unquestioned and non-controversial
reputation and do not have any conflict of interest with the aims and objects of the Daanish School.
(4) The Authority shall nominate one of the members of the governing body as convener of the
governing body.
(5) The Principal of the concerned Daanish School shall be the secretary of the governing body
of that School.
(6) No person shall be appointed as member of more than two governing bodies.
(7) The Authority may delegate administrative and financial powers of a Daanish School to its
governing body in the manner prescribed by regulations.
(8) The Authority may, for reasons to be recorded in writing, dissolve a governing body and
appoint a new governing body within three months of such dissolution.
(9) If the Authority dissolves a governing body, it may appoint any person as administrator of
that Daanish School to look after the affairs of the School till the appointment of the governing body.

provisions.title: Section 10. Admission to Daanish School.
provisions.content:
_ (1) The governing body shall ensure that admissions in
the Daanish School shall be merit-based and only ten percent of total seats of students shall pay such fee
and other expenses as may be prescribed by regulations.
(2) Subject to sub-section (1), the Governing Body shall admit destitute children, in order of
precedence, under any of the following categories, namely: ___
(a)     orphan having lost both of his parents and having no guardian;
(b)     orphan and living with real parent; and
(c)     both parents are alive but are illiterate and do not own immoveable property and
either of them is disabled and have no source of income.
(4) The governing body may admit a student whose one of the parent is an employee of the
Daanish School.
(5) The governing body shall determine the merit for the admission in the school on the basis of
criteria prescribed by regulations.
(6) The Authority may, for the reasons to be recorded in writing, alter or set-aside any decision
of the governing body if it finds that the decision is not based on the criteria for admission.

provisions.title: Section 11. Finance Committee.
provisions.content:
_ The Authority shall constitute a Finance Committee consisting of
such members having such functions as may be prescribed by regulations.

provisions.title: Section 12. Fund
provisions.content:
_(1) There shall be established a fund to be known as the Daanish Schools Authority
Fund which shall vest in the Authority and shall be utilized by the Authority for the purpose of this Act,
and to meet charges and expenditures in connection with its functions including salaries and other
remuneration of the Managing Director, members, officers, staff, experts and consultants of the
Authority.
(2) The fund shall be kept in such custody and shall be utilized and regulated in such manner as
may be prescribed by rules.
(3) The Fund shall be consist of,
(a)     grants made by the Government;
(b)     funds provided by the Federal and provincial government;
(c)     loans and grants from the national or international agencies received by the
Authority to finance the functions of the Authority;
(d)     charges and fees collected by such sources as may be
approved by the Authority;
(e)     income from investments and deposits as approved by the Authority and in
accordance with rules;
(f)     income from the sale of movable or immovable property; and
(g)     donations and endowments.

provisions.title: Section 13. Budget and Accounts.
provisions.content:
_ (1) The Managing Director shall prepare the annual budget of the
Authority.
(2) The Managing Director shall, with the approval of the Chairperson, place the budget proposals
for approval before the Authority.
(3) The accounts of the Authority shall be maintained in such manner as may be prescribed by
rules.

provisions.title: Section 14. Audit.
provisions.content:
_ (1) The annual accounts of the Authority shall be audited in terms of Articles 169
and 170 of the Constitution and by a reputable firm of chartered accountants, within the meaning of
Chartered Accountants Ordinance, 1961 (X of 1961), appointed by the Authority.
(2) The provisions of the Public Finance Management Act, 2019 mutatis mutandis shall apply to
the Authority.

provisions.title: Section 15. Reports
provisions.content:
_ (1) The Executive Committee shall prepare and submit, to the Authority, an
annual performance report of the Schools for the year ending on 30th April.
(2) The Authority shall submit the annual performance report, for a financial year before 31st
July, to the Government.

provisions.title: Section 16. Public servants
provisions.content:
_A person appointed, acting or purporting to act in pursuance of any
provision of this Act, shall be deemed to be public servant within the meaning of section 21 of the
Pakistan Penal Code, 1860 (XLV of 1860).

provisions.title: Section 17. Instructions and guidelines
provisions.content:
_(1) The Authority may issue general or special instructions
or guidelines to the Executive Committee and governing bodies for proper management of the Daanish
Schools on any matter related to the functioning of the school.
(2) The instructions or guidelines issued by the Authority shall be binding on such Executive
Committee and governing body.

provisions.title: Section 18. Transfer of government employees
provisions.content:
_(1) The Government may, with the concurrence of
the Authority, transfer the services of any of its employees to the Authority.
(2) The Authority may, with the concurrence of an employee and the Government, absorb or
induct the services of the employee into its service.
(3) The terms and conditions of the services of an employee transferred from the Government or
absorbed in the service of the Authority shall be such as may be prescribed.

provisions.title: Section 19. Rules
provisions.content:
_The Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette make rules for
carrying out the purposes of this Act.

provisions.title: Section 20. Regulations
provisions.content:
_Subject to the rules made under section 19, the Authority may, by notification
in the official Gazette make regulations to give effect to the provisions of the Act.

provisions.title: Section 21. Indemnity
provisions.content:
_No suit, prosecution or other proceedings shall lie against the Federal
Government or its officer for anything in good faith, done or intended to be done in pursuance of this
Act or the rules made thereunder.

provisions.title: Section 22. Savings
provisions.content:
_All schools established or notified as Daanish Schools before the commencement
of this Act shall be deemed to have been established or notified under this Act.
